text: Lauren C. Vaughan is an American civil servant from Washington, D.C. who served as Secretary of the District of Columbia from 2015 to 2018. == Education == Vaughan earned a Bachelor of Arts degree in Mass Media Arts from Hampton University and a Master of Science in Engineering and Technology Management from George Washington University. == Career == She had since worked in various organizations as trainer, manager and chief executive. From 2001 she was Co-Chair and Board Chair of My Sister's Place, a domestic violence shelter. From 2009 to 2015, she was Chief Executive of My Sister's Place. Vaughan became Secretary of the District of Columbia on January 2, 2015 as a member of the Democratic Party. == References == Category:20th-century births Category:American social activists Category:George Washington University School of Engineering and Applied Science alumni Category:Hampton University alumni Category:Living people Category:Secretaries of the District of Columbia Category:Washington, D.C. Democrats Category:Women in District of Columbia politics Category:Year of birth missing (living people)
title: Lauren Vaughan
